body.p: “The snow is drifted and much deeper about the button-bushes “,” etc. It is surprising what an effect a thin barrier of bushes has on it “,” causing it to lodge there until often a very large drift is formed more or less abrupt on the south. Woolgrass still rises above the snow along the sides.”
PE 11, pg. 218-219 / 7 September 1856-1 April 1857/ NNPM MA 1302:28 / T vol. # XXII / PDF # XV / JIX
